# Pro Design System Starter Kit

Basic design system starter kit containing key building blocks to get started with building your own design system. 

# Features

- Atoms and molecules: Key starter compoents such as button, card, carousel, image, skeleton, gallery
- Auto generate storybook stories (no need to write stories)
- Dark and light mode
- Multi theme support
- Eslint & Prettier setup out of the box
- Jest testing setup out of the box

## Getting Started

To start building your own design systemm, clone this repo to a new directory:

```bash
yarn install
```

and run:

```bash
yarn start:dev
```

To run in production mode, run:

```bash
yarn start:prod
```

To run the unit tests for the components, run:

```bash
yarn test
```

To run Storybooks, run:

```bash
yarn storybooks.run
```

Need help with creating stencil components? Check out Stencil docs [here](https://stenciljs.com/docs/my-first-component).


## Naming Components

When creating new component tags, we recommend _not_ using `stencil` in the component name (ex: `<stencil-datepicker>`). This is because the generated component has little to nothing to do with Stencil; it's just a web component!

Instead, use a prefix that fits your company or any name for a group of related components. For example, all of the Pro generated web components use the prefix `pro`.


## Using this component

There are three strategies we recommend for using web components built with Stencil.

The first step for all three of these strategies is to [publish to NPM](https://docs.npmjs.com/getting-started/publishing-npm-packages).

### Script tag

- Put a script tag similar to this `<script src='https://unpkg.com/my-component@0.0.1/dist/mycomponent.js'></script>` in the head of your index.html
- Then you can use the element anywhere in your template, JSX, html etc

### Node Modules
- Run `npm install my-component --save`
- Put a script tag similar to this `<script src='node_modules/my-component/dist/mycomponent.js'></script>` in the head of your index.html
- Then you can use the element anywhere in your template, JSX, html etc
